channel.title: üè¢ University of Texas at Austin on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Texas at Austin on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Active Classification with Few Queries under Misspecification
item.description: Learning halfspaces efficiently under noise is cracked! A novel query language enables a polylog query algorithm for Massart noise, overcoming previous limitations.

item.title: HydraLoRA: An Asymmetric LoRA Architecture for Efficient Fine-Tuning
item.description: HydraLoRA: Asymmetric LoRA boosts LLM fine-tuning efficiency by sharing parameters across tasks while specializing others, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: In-Context Learning with Transformers: Softmax Attention Adapts to Function Lipschitzness
item.description: Softmax attention in transformers adapts its attention window to function Lipschitzness and noise, enabling efficient in-context learning.

item.title: Learning Noisy Halfspaces with a Margin: Massart is No Harder than Random
item.description: Proper learning of noisy halfspaces with margins is achievable with sample complexity matching random classification noise, defying prior expectations.

item.title: LightGaussian: Unbounded 3D Gaussian Compression with 15x Reduction and 200+ FPS
item.description: LightGaussian achieves 15x compression of 3D Gaussian scene representations, boosting rendering speed to 200+ FPS while maintaining visual quality, solving storage and efficiency issues in real-time n…

item.title: Non-asymptotic Global Convergence Analysis of BFGS with the Armijo-Wolfe Line Search
item.description: BFGS algorithm achieves global linear and superlinear convergence rates with inexact Armijo-Wolfe line search, even without precise Hessian knowledge.
